meanings.definition: A deep, loud roar or cry typically made by a large animal.
meanings.sent1: The lion's bellowing echoed through the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The bellowing of the elephant could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The bellowing of the cow startled the chickens nearby.
meanings.sent4: The bellowing of the storm shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The bellowing of the bull was both intimidating and powerful.

meanings.definition: To shout loudly and with a deep voice.
meanings.sent1: He was bellowing for help when he fell into the river.
meanings.sent2: The coach was bellowing instructions to the players on the field.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was bellowing with joy as he played with his toys.
meanings.sent4: She bellowed her frustration at the malfunctioning printer.
meanings.sent5: The sergeant bellowed orders to the troops, commanding attention.

meanings.definition: The act of making a deep, loud sound.
meanings.sent1: The bellowing of the thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The bellowing of the horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The bellowing of the wind made the trees sway wildly.
meanings.sent4: The bellowing of the engine indicated a problem.
meanings.sent5: The bellowing of the crowd at the concert was deafening.
